title.narrative: To provide access to Education,Health and Hygiene for Rag Picking Communities living in NCR

description.narrative: 200 children receive bridge education;Providing clean water, nutrition and medical check-up to improve children's health;Sensitization of parents to the importance of education and smooth re-entry to school for children, basic awareness on health and hygiene. facilitate admission of children in the main schools. The activities will ensure that children health and hygiene habits will improve leading to healthy life. By going to school, children are expected less time on garbage collection and more time on academics. Awareness to parents will ensure that more children are turned out to school and less drop outs.

Christian Aid fundraising and supporter team supported phia foundation to get a three year project for addressing education, health and hygiene needs of rag picking communities based in NCR from Monsoon Accessorize Trust, UK. Phia Foundation is directly implementing a project on providing bridge school facilities to rag picking community.Mobilisation and awareness raising with community, community leaders and local stakeholders. Phia will ensure the following activities. - Honorarium to three teaching Teachers - Purchase and distribution of education materials for children - Capacity building trainings: Child Rights, POCSO, Child's expression, etc. - Sport and important day celebration in local area - Supply of clean water and nutritious food for children - Organising health camps - Regular meeting with parents, teachers of the school where the children are enrolled to know the progress and continuity of education to the children. In the year 2 and 3 it has been proposed skill building activity on garment stitching and sewing to women from the community, capacity building and exposure visits of Fellows and support to children for their higher education.
